intro: Argyrocome argyropsis, commonly known as the silver-leafed daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disc florets. The plant features silver-gray foliage with a velvety texture, which helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming during the cooler months. Argyrocome argyropsis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and drought tolerance.
